name: pirogi
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(also pirog) a Russian or Ukrainian pie made with a pastry container filled with savoury or sweet food: The book gives an introduction to Russia's best-known dishes, including pirogi and blinis. The Ukrainian diner has fantastic broccoli and cheese pirogis. Cook the pirog in the oven for 10-15 minutes. Pirogs have always been an important part of Russian festivities.
a Polish dumpling (= a type of pastry filled with savoury or sweet food) that is boiled and may also be fried: Restaurants serve up platters of pirogis. Every wheat-growing nation has its own version of pasta - udon in Japan, pirogi in Poland. Synonym
pierogi
